byline.original: By MICHAEL CORKERY and MARY WILLIAMS WALSH

abstract: Puerto Rico Gov Alejandro Garcia Padilla concedes that commonwealth cannot pay its roughly $72 billion in debts, announcing plans for broad restructuring that could have far-reaching repercussions; will represent unprecedented test of United States' market for municipal bonds, which island has issued at by far highest rate in country; commonwealth will seek concessions from nearly all of its creditors.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Alejandro García Padilla said that his administration would probably seek significant concessions from its creditors on a $72 billion debt load.

headline.main: Puerto Rico’s Governor Says Island’s Debts Are ‘Not Payable’
headline.print_headline: In Puerto Rico, Debt Is Called ‘Not Payable’

snippet: Gov. Alejandro García Padilla said that his administration would probably seek significant concessions from its creditors on a $72 billion debt load.
